p: There was a significant decrease (p < 0.05) in MMP of cells subjected to 3 h anoxia (severe hypoxia) compared to normoxia. This was characterized by marked staining of the “J-aggregate” form of JC- 1 (red fluorescence) with few monomer forms (green fluorescence) of normoxia-exposed cells compared to anoxia-exposed cells ( Fig. 5). The difference in the loss of mitochondrial integrity of cells was visible with the loss of red stain (polarized J-aggregates form, ~ 590 nm excitation) on exposure to anoxic condition. In Fig. 5, astrocytes that were treated with 1 and 10 μg/mL TT before anoxia exposure exhibited a marked restoration of MMP (p < 0.05) in JC-1 staining compared to untreated anoxia-exposed astrocytes.
